text: Scirpophaga aurivena is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1903. It is found in the Khasi Hills of north-eastern India. The wingspan is 19–22 mm. The forewings are pale yellow, but yellow between the veins. The hindwings are white. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1903 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Moths of India
title: Scirpophaga aurivena
